name: Thousand Year Thunder
description:
"The faint warmth of the morning sun slowly makes it's way through the short, prickly fur on your face. After what feels like an eternity, you slowly build up the courage to open your eyes to the wondrous new dawn."

Welcome to the strange world of Paradise, where forces of nature live and breathe among the rest of us. You take the role of True, the devilish son of Thunder, who has just woken up from a nice nap just to find himself in the middle of f***ing nowhere. Also, your trident is gone.

Great.

Explore the first two steps of your journey complete with a colorful cast of characters, enemies and of course, a whole bunch of nooks and crannies filled with secrets!

Thousand Year Thunder is a story-driven bullet hell adventure game with hints of visual novel elements mixed in for good measure. The demo includes the first two worlds of the full game, complete with unique loot, bossfights and a soundtrack made by my good friend Julius and yours Truly (teehee). The game aims to provide a rather challenging experience, so if this is your first bullet hell, do be prepared to die a lot.

Check out the full soundtrack on Youtube!

May contain profanity and mildly suggestive content.
